bibl.title: Letter from Michael E. Connor to Laura Armistead Carter, October 24, 1920

div1.p: Connor writes that he has seen Henry Carter and praises his yellow fever work in Peru. He requests two of Carter's reports.

div1.head: Letter from Michael E. Connor to Laura Armistead Carter, October 24, 1920
div1.opener:

Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I have just come from
Piura where I had a most pleasant
visit with your Father. He is well but
is I think tired, altho he would not
admit it. The work of stamping out
yellow fever in Peru has been a most
brillant demonstration in of the practical
application of knowledge and the, credit
rightfully belongs to Dr. Carter. To me
the work here will rank with the
best of his long and useful life.

Your Father told me that I might
apply to you for copies of two of his y. f.
reports which I am most anxious to
have for my files, they are:-

“Spontaneous elimination of yellow fever
by failure of the human host. Liverpool
C1
B22
Journal 1920? also “Yellow Fever Immunity ”
Liverpool Journal.

If the above are available will you
please send me one copy each %International
Health Board, 61 Broadway, New York City.

Thanking you and with sincere good
wishes, I remain.
div1.closer: Cordially yours, M. E. Connor. Connor
